title: noReactSpecificProps
description: |
  Prevents React-specific JSX properties from being used.
---
import { Tabs, TabItem } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

**Diagnostic Category: `lint/suspicious/noReactSpecificProps`**
<Tabs>
<TabItem label="JavaScript (and super languages)" icon="seti:javascript">
**Since**: `v1.7.2`
:::note
- This rule has a **safe** fix.
:::

Sources: 
- Same as: <a href="https://github.com/solidjs-community/eslint-plugin-solid/blob/main/packages/eslint-plugin-solid/docs/no-react-specific-props.md" target="_blank"><code>solidjs/no-react-specific-props</code></a>

Prevents React-specific JSX properties from being used.

This rule is intended for use in JSX-based frameworks (mainly **Solid.js**)
that do not use React-style prop names.

## Examples

### Invalid

```jsx
<Hello className="John" />
```

### Valid

```jsx
<Hello class="Doe" />
```
